ngiemboon: N júʼ tsɔ̌ ngyè tetʉ̂ fó tsɛ̀ɛ jʉʼʉ ssé ńne ńgɔɔn mbwó mecÿɔ́ʼ Ssé pa sɔɔnmbʉ́a ngie: «Pi gʉa ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, ḿpfɛte gyáŋalóŋ Ssé gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ mentúʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a lɛ̂!»
en: Then I heard a loud voice from the temple saying to the seven angels,   “Go and pour out the seven  # 16:1 Other mss omit seven bowls  # 16:1 Rv 17:1; 21:9 of God’s wrath on the earth.”

ngiemboon: Andùŋmvfò gʉa ḿpfɛte ye ntúʼ ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ. Etsɔ̌ ntí mefʉ̌ŋ gie mé líe é vege pʉ̀a vege, ḿbiŋ ńgyáŋ páʼɔɔn tɛʼ, é kẅɛ́te na pʉ̀a mesoŋ pie mé la cÿɔʼɔ liŋé nkʉ̀ʼʉ nɔ̀ɔn na pɔ́b, pɔ́ piŋ ńne ńŋwɔ́ʼɔ nnɛ́ mvfò tútú nkʉ̀ʼʉ nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́.
en: The first went and poured out his bowl on the earth, and severely painful sores   broke out on the people who had the mark of the beast and who worshiped its image.

ngiemboon: Ambɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a pfɛte ye ntúʼ tsɛ̀ɛ ntse tépàa. Ntse tépàa sele ńcʉ́ʼ páʼ metse nyìŋ gẅie à kwě la. Akɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ ntse tépàa tà ńŋele ŋele pú ńkwé.
en: The second   poured out his bowl into the sea. It turned to blood like that of a dead person, and all life in the sea died.  # 16:3 Rv 8:8–9

ngiemboon: Ambɔ́ɔntè yétá pfɛte ye ntúʼ tsɛ̀ɛ memí mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ mesaʼá ntse, mentse ŋwɛ́ sele ńcʉ́ʼ metse.
en: The third   poured out his bowl into the rivers and the springs of water, and they became blood.  # 16:4 Ex 7:17–21

ngiemboon: N júʼ, Cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé gẅie à la gẅiin nò na mentse ne ńgɔɔn ngie: «Gù gẅie ɔɔ wó, mbà ɔ̀ laa wó, Gù gẅie ɔɔ Ssé, ɔ̀ gÿo pɛ́ʼɛ̀ á gwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ á kɔʼɔ́ gwɔ́ púʼu, á nue, ɔ̀ gÿǒ pɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ.
en: I heard the angel of the waters say,

ngiemboon: Á nue pɔ́ la pfɛte metse pʉ̀a pú, mbɔɔ me pantsẅìnkʉ̀ pú. Ɔ̀ kě ńná metse pɔ́ nú. Á gwɔ́ páʼ á kɔʼɔ́ ńne ńzɛ́te ngie mé gÿo na pɔ́b púʼu!»
en: Because they poured out

ngiemboon: N júʼ ngyè nyìŋ fó jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé Ngàŋa Tʉ̀ Ntsèm, agù létsɔ́ʼte ntsaŋ aa nénʉ́, ḿbiŋ ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ.»
en: I heard the altar say,

ngiemboon: Ambɔ́ɔntè lekùɔ pfɛte ye ntúʼ na nèm, e Ssé gÿo páʼ nèm ge lɔg mmɔ̌g tuɔ pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: The fourth   poured out his bowl on the sun. It was allowed to scorch people with fire,

ngiemboon: Ejʉʼ leen ńké ḿbú ńdum lum tà ńtuɔ pʉ̀a mesoŋ. Pɔ́ zoonte lezíŋ Ssé, á yé gẅie yé zɔ gÿo tá pɔ́ gyá yɔɔn ngɔ́ʼ ntí ntí, ńgÿo púʼu, ńké te kúbe mà wɔ́b ńnáa legúʼ mbwó Ssé wɔ́.
en: and people were scorched by the intense heat. So they blasphemed the name of God,   who has the power  # 16:9 Or authority over these plagues, and they did not repent and give him glory.  # 16:9 Rv 9:20–21

ngiemboon: Ambɔ́ɔntè yétʉ̂a pfɛte ye ntúʼ na lʉŋe lefùɔ nkʉ̀ʼʉ nɔ̀ɔn wɛ̌. Nzěm pú ńjÿó láʼa nɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́. Epʉ̀a mesoŋ gyá ngɔ́ʼ gyǎ tà ḿpfɛ́ɛ lʉ́me yɔ́b.
en: The fifth   poured out his bowl on the throne of the beast,  # 16:10 Rv 2:13; 13:2 and its kingdom was plunged into darkness.  # 16:10 Ex 10:21 People  # 16:10 Lit They gnawed their tongues because of their pain

ngiemboon: Ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ yɔb mbɔɔ mefʉ̌ŋ mɔ́b gÿo pɔ́ zoonte Ssé gie ee tÿǒ lepwó, táʼ ńké te kúbe mà wɔb, ńgwáʼ mefàʼ tepòŋ mɔ́b wɔ́.
en: and blasphemed the God of heaven   because of their pains and their sores, but they did not repent of their works.

ngiemboon: Ambɔ́ɔntè ntɔgɔ́ pfɛte ye ntúʼ tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ̌ máamáa mí gẅie mé tóŋo lê Efelad. Ntse mí ŋwɛ́ júm, ńtsɔ́ʼ nzsè mbwó mefùɔ pie éfóo Sǎʼnèm.
en: The sixth   poured out his bowl on the great river Euphrates,  # 16:12 Gn 2:14; 15:18; Dt 11:24; 1Kg 4:21; Rv 9:14 and its water was dried up  # 16:12 Ex 14:21–22,29; 15:19; Jos 2:10; 4:23; 5:1; 2Kg 2:8; Neh 9:11; Is 51:10 to prepare the way for the kings from the east.

ngiemboon: N gyá tsɔ̌ ssé tepòŋ fó ncwò máamáa nnúngém ńkẅɛ, yetsɔ̌ fó ncwò nkʉ̀ʼʉ nɔ̀ɔn ńkẅɛ, yetsɔ̌ fó ncwò ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé we cÿɔ̌nò ńkẅɛ, tà pɔ́ gwɔ́ métá, ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ metètɔ̀ʼ la,
en: Then I saw three unclean spirits like frogs   coming from the dragon’s mouth,  # 16:13 Rv 12:9 from the beast’s mouth,  # 16:13 Rv 13:1 and from the mouth of the false prophet.  # 16:13 Rv 13:11–17

ngiemboon: ée púʼu, ńgwɔ́ messé tepòŋ mie é gÿo menò mɔɔnmɔɔn. Pɔ́ ge gʉa gyá mefùɔ pie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ ntsèm, légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ ge cúʼte wɔ́b, é lɔg zẅíʼte ncù gẅie é ge láʼ gwɔ́ na máamáa lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ gie, e Ssé ngàŋa tʉ̀ ntsèm ge láʼ ŋag pʉ̀a mesoŋ.
en: For they are demonic spirits performing signs,   who travel to the kings of the whole world to assemble them  # 16:14 1Kg 22:20–23; Mt 24:24; 2Th 2:10 for the battle on the great day of God, the Almighty.  # 16:14 Ezk 38–39; Jl 2:11; 3:2; Zch 14:2; Rv 19:11–21

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn ngie: «Pi ké ńzsé ngie, n ge tó páʼ ntsǒŋ la. Ashÿó mbòŋo aa nyìŋ gẅie n ge gwaa tó, á le ne ńdyé wɔ́, menzsǒ mé gwɔ́ na yé, ḿbɔ́gɔ páʼ à ge lu ssé, é giŋ té jÿɔ́g nzsǒ, eshʉ́ kúu yé.»
en: “Look, I am coming like a thief. Blessed    is the one who is alert and remains clothed   # 16:15 Or and guards his clothes,# 16:15 Lk 12:35–40; 1Th 5:2,6–8 so that he may not go around naked and people see his shame.”   # 16:15 Rv 3:18

ngiemboon: Messé tepòŋ pɛ̌ léen ńké ńcúʼte mefùɔ na tsɔ́ jʉʼ gie mé tóŋo na shwóŋè pa Ébɛ̀ lê Mbɛtezata.
en: So they assembled the kings at the place called in Hebrew, Armageddon.  ,# 16:16 Jdg 5:19; 2Kg 9:27; Ezk 38:8

ngiemboon: Cÿɔ́ʼ Ssé mbɔ́ɔntè sɔɔnmbʉ́a pfɛte ye ntúʼ tÿǒ tsɛ̀ɛ fÿɔ́g. Etsɔ̌ ngyè tetʉ̂ fó na lʉŋe lefùɔ gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ jʉʼʉ Ssé ńkẅɛ, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Á zsoté!»
en: Then the seventh   poured out his bowl into the air,  # 16:17 Or bowl on the air and a loud voice came out of the temple  # 16:17 Other mss add of heaven,# 16:17 Is 66:6 from the throne, saying, “It is done! ”

ngiemboon: Menně mbʉ̀ŋ kyɛʼ jʉʼ, mé júʼ mengyè pʉ̀a mesoŋ, lefaŋ vɛ́te ngʉ̀a ngʉ̀a. Atsetsáʼ pú ńcʉʼʉ tɛʼ, tà mbà tà fó páʼ nyìŋ mesoŋ aa ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, á laa zɔɔn ńcʉʼʉ púʼu wɔ́.
en: There were flashes of lightning, rumblings, and peals of thunder. And a severe earthquake occurred like no other since people have been on the earth, so great was the quake.

ngiemboon: Máamáa tÿǒsoŋ wɛ̌ shʉ́ate nzsè tá. Metÿǒsoŋ mie ée ngwòŋo ngwòŋ, é keme. E Ssé leen ńké ńkímte máamáa tÿǒsoŋo Mbambilonia, ńgÿo á nú ntúʼ melùʼ gyáŋalóŋ yé gie á pú ńgáʼ.
en: The great city   split into three parts, and the cities of the nations  # 16:19 Or the Gentile cities fell. Babylon the Great was remembered in God’s presence; he gave her the cup filled with the wine of his fierce anger.  # 16:19 Rv 14:19; 19:15

ngiemboon: Meláʼ mie ntse la kéle ńnéŋe soŋ, é pú shú ńkúu ntse. Mé té gíŋ ńgyá mekwɛ́ mie ée ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ wɔ́.
en: Every island fled, and the mountains disappeared.

ngiemboon: Memǎa megẅi mie ngwɔ́ tàʼ jÿó kílò móm lekùɔ, fó tÿó ńgwete na pʉ̀a mesoŋ. Epʉ̀a mesoŋ zoonte Ssé, ńtí ngɔ́ʼ gie pɔ́ gyǎ, é fóo na megẅi, á nue yɛ̌ ngɔ́ʼ la pú ńtʉ tɛʼ.
en: Enormous hailstones, each weighing about a hundred pounds,   fell from the sky on people, and they blasphemed God  # 16:21 Rv 16:9,11 for the plague of hail because that plague was extremely severe.  # 16:21 Jos 10:11; Ezk 38:22
